text: <@U02J1440N13> - I believe you can do that without custom code.

<@U01ASFZL4UA>
How ? I am using Deal-based workflow and eventually the workflow will send an email to all contacts in a specific deal.

I was thinking, is there a way to fetch a certain contact from a deal using custom code ?
So that i can inject this contact in another workflow and send him the email.
I was thinking, is there a way to fetch a certain contact from a deal using custom code ? - Yes. Search API and then WF API
Can one contact be customer and sales person at the same time?

<@U01ASFZL4UA>
No.
So if i can use custom code to fetch the contact of type customer in the deal for example that would be awesome.
Do you, by any chance, have some sort of documentation on this ?

Hey everyone,

I'm running into a wall trying to update a date or a datetime property of a custom object with a workflow.

Ive got a custom coded action that outputs a date in unix. But I'm unable to update the a date or datetime property or an enrolled object. The error returned is "_Unable to update property because property value isn't valid_".

Any ideas how I might format the output to work date properties?
